verb.description: Separate (lighter and heavier particles in a mixture) by suspension in an upward flow of liquid or gas.
examples: the unelutriated cells showed a broad distribution of cell volume compared with the elutriated fractions

origin: Mid 18th century: from Latin elutriat- washed out, from the verb elutriare, from e- (variant of ex-) out + lutriare to wash.
